"It would be nice," Pompei said of quarterbacks possessing only positive qualities. But really when a guy is throwing touchdown passes and winning games, you don't notice all that[ negative] stuff. Fran Tarkenton talked about how difficult it could be for Jay Cutler to change the perception of those around the league. But Jay Cutler only has to do what Ben Roethlisberger and Michael Vick did to recover from their scandals- win.

Mr Donald Rumsfeld suggests Mr Bush was at fault for not doing more to resolve disagreements among senior advisers. The president did not always receive, and may not have insisted on, a timely consideration of his options before he made a decision, nor did he always receive effective implementation of the decisions he made, Mr Donald Rumsfeld wrote. Mr Stephen Elop said the world's biggest mobile operators were "all smiles" about the tie-up because Nokia has traditionally been more amiable to telecoms providers than Apple or Google. This is good news for operators, he said. "We are in a position to create a third ecosystem. We know what it means to be the most friendly to the operators." losing engineers frustrated by a shift in the culture that normally happens when a company gets as big as Google is," Seth Harris , technology practice head at Tim Cook Associates, told the E-Commerce Times. Engineers fear the company is not moving fast enough and say it's harder to get time with leaders; many have already made money with Google and see opportunities to move to big private tech firms expected to go public in 12 to 18 months. There has also been talk of tension between Eric Schmidt and Page on competing priorities, Seth Harris added, with Eric Schmidt emphasizing the need to protect margins and Page pushing for more innovation.
